b.
software architecture and a software design pattern.
UNIT1.answer: software architecture and a software design pattern.

Three-tier architecture has the following three tiers:
UNIT1.answer: b. Presentation tier, Application tier and Data tier

UNIT1.question: Which one of the following is true ?
UNIT1.answer: c. In HTML Certain elements don’t need a closing tag, in XHTML all elements must be explicitly closed.

Three-tier is a client–server architecture in which
UNIT1.answer: the user interface, functional process logic ("business rules"), computer data storage and data access are developed and maintained as independent modules

UNIT2.answer: c. The most effective way to control how typography looks on a web page is through using Cascading Style Sheet.

Concerning navigation
UNIT2.answer: a. One of the most crucial aspects of successful site navigation is consistency

UNIT2.question: Concerning the Home Page, which of the following is true
UNIT2.answer: d. It is a common misconception to think that the home page is the first page your site visitors will see.

UNIT2.question: Which of the following is true
UNIT2.answer: b. The primary colours consist of red, yellow and blue, and they’re called primary colours because you don’t need to mix colours to make these three hues.

UNIT2.question: A triadic colour scheme is created
UNIT2.answer: c. when you pick one colour and then pick two other colours that lie equidistant from each other around the circle

UNIT2.question: In testing mobile websites on mobile devices, we found that sites with fewer features have much better usability than full-featured websites. This year's winning mobile intranets followed this recommendation, focusing on specific features that were important to employees on the go instead of trying to squeeze the entire intranet onto a tiny screen.
most web designers limit themselves to the most commonly-available fonts across all systems, which are usually limited to the following:
UNIT2.answer: c. Andale Mono, Times New Roman, Georgia, Verdana, Arial/Arial Black, Courier/Courier New, Trebuchet MS, Comic Sans (this is an unprofessional, many would say ugly font—don’t use this, except perhaps sparingly on sites aimed at children).

UNIT2.question: The home page should, at least provide the following:
UNIT2.answer: b. define the main goal of the site and provide an overview, show what’s new, introduce the brand, provide navigation to other areas of the site.

UNIT2.question: Systems that force people to create content from scratch, every time promotes and encourages user participation.

When designing a website, the golden rule is that "content is king!" No matter how flashy and colorful a website is, it is virtually useless without organized, accessible content. This means that a person searching for information must be able to quickly find it on your website. If not, they will leave.
Although Nielsen’s philosophy of bare-bones Web architecture has accessibility and usability merits, most Web designers want to add a signature touch to their sites with many design elements

UNIT2.answer: c. Andale Mono, Times New Roman, Georgia, Verdana, Arial/Arial Black, Courier/Courier New, Trebuchet MS, Comic Sans (this is an unprofessional, many would say ugly font—don’t use this, except perhaps sparingly on sites aimed at children).

UNIT2.question: Sometimes, knowledge sharing can be as simple as a Q&A tool to connect employees with questions to colleagues with answers.
Which of the following is true
UNIT2.answer: b. As long as there is an apparent progress from one link to the next, and the indication is that they are still on track to reach their end goal, users will tend to continue through a site.

UNIT2.question: Whilst it may be tempting to cram in a little of everything on the home page, it is actually better to use it to highlight other areas of content within the site and drive your traffic to them.
Which of the following is true
UNIT2.answer: c. A good technique is to search the web for other websites in your line of business. Take a look at their design, content and navigation for ideas as how to organize the content of your website.

UNIT3.question: Which of the following is true
UNIT3.answer: a. HTML elements can have attributes. Attributes provide additional information about an element. Attributes are always specified in the start tag. Attributes come in name/value pairs like: name="value"

UNIT3.answer: c. HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language is a language for describing web pages and not a programming language
